item.title: 汇丰在改革中短期留用部分银行家
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，汇丰控股公司（HSBC Holdings Plc）在新任首席执行官乔治-埃尔德里（Georges Elhedery）的领导下进行大刀阔斧的改革，在清理各项业务的过程中，将对部分投资银行家签订短期留用协议。【原文：HSBC Holdings Plc is placing some of its investment bankers on short-term retention agreements as it winds down various businesses in a broad overhaul led by new Chief Executive Officer Georges Elhedery, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 英特尔首席执行官表示将坚持有争议的代工厂计划
item.description: 英特尔公司（Intel Corp.即将上任的英特尔公司首席执行官陈立武表示，他将坚持前任的计划，为其他公司生产芯片，同时他也发誓要从过去的错误中吸取教训。【原文：Incoming Intel Corp. Chief Executive Officer Lip-Bu Tan is signaling that he’ll stick with his predecessor’s plan to make chips for other companies, even as he vows to learn from past mistakes.】

item.title: Ares 寻求从银行购买新世界发展债务
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，Ares Management Corp. 最近几周至少与两家银行进行了接触，希望购买它们持有的香港开发商新世界发展有限公司（New World Development Co.【原文：Ares Management Corp. approached at least two banks in recent weeks to purchase their holdings of debt issued by Hong Kong developer New World Development Co., according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 调查人员预测伦敦房价将出现英国最严重的下跌
item.description: 据房产中介称，由于首都受到经济不确定性和高税收的严重影响，伦敦的房价在短期内将创下英国最大跌幅。【原文：London is expected to record the largest drop in house prices in the UK in the near term, according to property agents, as the capital is disproportionately hit by economic uncertainty and higher taxes.】

item.title: 越南追逐美国交易，高官飞赴越南会见特朗普团队
item.description: 越南最高贸易官员即将前往美国，希望说服唐纳德-特朗普总统的团队，让他们相信河内对重启贸易关系是认真的，以避免关税可能对其出口导向型经济造成冲击。【原文：Vietnam’s top trade official is heading to the US in a bid to persuade President Donald Trump’s team that Hanoi is serious about resetting trade ties, to avert tariffs that could rattle its export-driven economy.】

item.title: 美国通胀缓解提振市场情绪，石油保持大幅上涨
item.description: 由于美国通胀放缓对更广泛的金融市场情绪有所帮助，石油价格在两周来的最大涨幅之后企稳。【原文：Oil steadied, after the biggest gain in two weeks, as easing US inflation aided broader financial market sentiment.】

item.title: 卡尼周五接任加拿大领导人后将缩减内阁规模
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士称，马克-卡尼将于周五宣誓就任加拿大第 24 任总理，新内阁的规模可能只有贾斯汀-特鲁多的行政部门的一半左右。【原文：Mark Carney will be sworn in as Canada’s 24th prime minister on Friday, along with a new cabinet that may be about half the size of Justin Trudeau’s executive, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 星展集团首位女首席执行官面临逆风，将人工智能视为游戏规则的改变者
item.description: 1995 年霸菱银行倒闭后，Tan Su Shan 失去了工作，她的香港房东认为她可能付不起房租，于是将她赶了出去。同一周，她的长期男友与她分手。两年后，她决定降薪加入另一家公司。【原文：When Barings Bank collapsed in 1995, Tan Su Shan lost her job and was evicted after her Hong Kong landlord thought she might not be able to pay rent. Her long-term boyfriend broke up with her the same week. Two years later, she decided to take a pay cut to join another firm.】

item.title: 台积电遭抛售，台股遭遇创纪录外资抛售
item.description: 由于重量级企业台湾积体电路制造股份有限公司（Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co.【原文：Taiwanese shares saw their worst-ever selling streak by foreign investors as heavyweight Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. fell out of favor.】

item.title: 美国通胀疲软后亚洲股市将上涨：市场综述
item.description: 在美国通胀率低于预期帮助华尔街从连续两天的重挫中反弹之后，亚洲股市周四早盘开始上涨。【原文：Asian equities were primed for early gains Thursday after cooler-than-forecast US inflation helped Wall Street rebound from two days of heavy losses.】

item.title: 斯塔默认为英国在推进数字化和人工智能方面可节约 450 亿英镑
item.description: 英国首相基尔-斯塔默（Keir Starmer）将宣布一项重塑英国国家的 "数字革命 "计划，称公共服务数字化和利用人工智能可以每年节省 450 亿英镑（580 亿美元）的生产成本。【原文：Prime Minister Keir Starmer is set to announce plans for a “digital revolution” to reshape the British state, saying that digitizing public services and harnessing artificial intelligence could unlock £45 billion ($58 billion) in annual productivity savings.】

item.title: 加拿大央行显示通胀将影响贸易战对策
item.description: 加拿大央行明确表示，全球各国央行正在打一场与大流行病完全不同的战争；但在决策者们试图保护本国经济免受美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的关税大棒冲击时，后科维德时代的通胀担忧正困扰着他们。【原文：The Bank of Canada made clear that central banks around the world are fighting an entirely different war than the pandemic — but post-Covid inflation fears are haunting policymakers as they try to protect their economies from US President Donald Trump’s tariff barrage.】

item.title: 加拿大 210 亿美元反倾销税涉及金属和高尔夫球
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）对钢铁和铝征收全球关税后，加拿大周三公布了一份报复性关税清单，适用于298亿加元（207亿美元）的美国商品，其中包括特朗普最喜欢的消遣项目。【原文：After US President Donald Trump imposed global tariffs on steel and aluminum, Canada on Wednesday revealed a list of retaliatory duties that apply to C$29.8 billion ($20.7 billion) of American goods — including ones used for Trump’s favorite pastime.】

item.title: 在 "全球风暴 "中，新西兰将自己定位为安全避难所
item.description: 新西兰总理在旨在吸引外国资本的投资者峰会上致开幕词，称新西兰是不稳定世界中的避风港。【原文：New Zealand’s prime minister pitched his country as a safe haven in an unstable world as he opened an Investor Summit aimed at attracting foreign capital.】

item.title: Supabase 开发者平台以 20 亿美元估值筹集现金
item.description:
Accel 主导了本轮超过 1 亿美元的融资。【原文：

Accel is leading the funding round of more than $100 million. 

】

item.title: Bluejay Therapeutics 据称最快将于下月考虑 IPO 事宜
item.description: 据知情人士透露，专注于治疗严重病毒性疾病和肝病的药物开发商 Bluejay Therapeutics 正在考虑在美国首次公开募股。【原文：Bluejay Therapeutics, a drug developer focused on serious viral and liver diseases, is considering a US initial public offering, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 交易量最大的加密货币在美国亲善之旅中走出阴影
item.description: 除了是世界上交易量最大的加密货币外，Tether Holdings SA 的稳定币多年来一直受到关于其储备和被犯罪分子使用的质疑。【原文：In addition to being the world’s most-traded cryptocurrency, Tether Holdings SA’s stablecoin has been dogged by questions for years over its reserves and use by criminals.】

item.title: 1600 多家金融公司使用美联储紧急借贷工具
item.description: 1600 多家银行及其附属机构利用了美联储的紧急贷款计划，该计划是在两年前的地区银行业动荡期间为支持该行业而设立的。【原文：More than 1,600 banks and their subsidiaries tapped the Federal Reserve’s emergency lending program created to support the industry during the regional banking turmoil two years ago.】

item.title: 英特尔任命芯片业资深人士陈立武为下任首席执行官
item.description: 英特尔公司任命陈立武为下一任首席执行官，将芯片行业最艰难的工作之一交给了这位前董事会成员和半导体资深人士。【原文：Intel Corp. named Lip-Bu Tan as its next chief executive officer, entrusting a former board member and semiconductor veteran with one of the toughest jobs in the chip industry.】

item.title: Adobe 公布不温不火的收入前景，重点关注人工智能工具
item.description: Adobe 公司对本季度收入增长的展望令人失望，尽管该公司最近将重点放在其新的生成式人工智能功能的货币化上。【原文：Adobe Inc. gave a disappointing outlook for revenue growth in the current quarter despite a recent focus on monetizing its new generative artificial intelligence features.】

item.title: 雪佛龙在委内瑞拉的承包商不顾特朗普的限期继续施工
item.description: 委内瑞拉石油承包商继续与雪佛龙公司合作，尽管美国政府规定了在 4 月初之前停止在委内瑞拉生产石油的最后期限，但他们并未收到即将停产的警告。【原文：Venezuelan oil contractors are continuing their work with Chevron Corp. and have not been warned of an impending shutdown despite a US government deadline to stop producing oil there by early April.】

item.title: 星巴克将增加座位和电源插座以吸引顾客
item.description: 星巴克公司打赌，如果顾客能找到一个舒适的地方为手机和笔记本电脑充电，他们就会流连忘返，点更多的拿铁咖啡。【原文：Starbucks Corp. is betting customers will linger and order more lattes if they can find a cozy spot to charge their phones and laptops.】

item.title: Chemours 提名激进分子 Vision One 的首席执行官进入董事会
item.description: Chemours Co.计划让 Vision One Management Partners 的首席执行官加入董事会，以避免与激进投资者发生代理权争夺战。【原文：Chemours Co. plans to add the chief executive officer of Vision One Management Partners to its board as it seeks to avoid a proxy fight with the activist investor.】

item.title: 特朗普的联邦贸易委员会着手对微软进行广泛的反垄断调查
item.description: 美国联邦贸易委员会（FTC）正在继续对微软公司（Microsoft Corp.）进行大范围的反垄断调查，这项调查是在拜登政府执政的最后几天启动的，这表明唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的新任联邦贸易委员会主席安德鲁-弗格森（Andrew Ferguson）将优先审查科技巨头。【原文：The US Federal Trade Commission is moving ahead with a sprawling antitrust probe of Microsoft Corp. that was opened in the waning days of the Biden Administration, signaling that Donald Trump’s new FTC Chair Andrew Ferguson is going to prioritize scrutiny of tech giants.】

item.title: 特朗普贸易战影响法国经济增长前景
item.description: 法国央行表示，全球贸易战的预期影响加剧了今年本已缓慢的经济开局，导致法国经济前景恶化。【原文：France’s economic outlook has deteriorated as the anticipated impact of a global trade war compounds an already slow start to the year, the country’s central bank said.】

item.title: 如果工资与美国同步，英国工人的收入将增加 4,000 英镑
item.description: 根据最新的分析，如果自金融危机以来英国工人的工资能与美国同行保持同步，那么英国工人的年收入将增加4000多英镑（5178美元）。【原文：British workers would be more than £4,000 ($5,178) a year better off if wages had kept pace with their American peers since the financial crisis, according to new analysis that lays bare the cost of the UK’s dismal productivity performance.】

item.title: Pimco 在美国、英国和澳大利亚任命五位新董事总经理
item.description: 太平洋投资管理公司（Pacific Investment Management Co.）将五名基金经理提升为董事总经理，相当于合伙人，也是该公司薪酬最高的职位，管理着近 2 万亿美元的资金。【原文：Pacific Investment Management Co. elevated five fund managers to managing director, the equivalent of partner and the most highly compensated positions at the firm overseeing almost $2 trillion.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利向投资者推介 Finastra 私募债务交易
item.description: 据知情人士透露，摩根士丹利（Morgan Stanley）已就可能向 Finastra Group Holdings Ltd. 贷款再融资的 40 亿美元一揽子债务计划向投资者发出了邀请。【原文：Morgan Stanley has sounded out investors regarding a potential $4 billion debt package to refinance loans for Finastra Group Holdings Ltd., according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 制药商 Mallinckrodt 和 Endo 正在洽谈合并事宜
item.description: 据知情人士透露，Mallinckrodt Pharmaceuticals 公司和 Endo Inc.【原文：Mallinckrodt Pharmaceuticals and Endo Inc. are exploring a potential merger that could be valued at about $7 billion, people with knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 美国财政年度迄今为止的预算缺口达到创纪录的 1.1 万亿美元
item.description: 2 月份，美国预算赤字继续膨胀，本财年前五个月的赤字达到 1.15 万亿美元，医疗保险和政府债务还本付息成本的增加导致了赤字的扩大。【原文：The US budget deficit continued to swell in February, pushing the shortfall to $1.15 trillion over the first five months of the fiscal year, with the increasing cost of Medicare and servicing government debt contributing to the widening.】
